title: IRC Archive for channel #xwiki - XWiki
content:

09:00 <sdumitriu> has quit  
09:06 <tmortagne> has joined #xwiki  
09:19 <vmassol> has joined #xwiki  
09:23 <+mflorea> tmortagne: I have found an unexpected bug/limitation regarding @Inject and I'd like to know if you are aware of it. I have a base class A which uses component C, but this is an implementation detail for A so it makes the corresponding field "c" private. Then I have a class B which extends A. By coincidence, B also needs component C, also as an implementation detail (in fact it needs C for a different purpose) so it declares a private field "c". The bug/limit  
09:23 <+tmortagne> mflorea: IRC limitation ;)  
09:23 <+mflorea> because the methods from A use the field from A  
09:24 <+mflorea> ok, so it is known  
09:24 <+tmortagne> no  
09:24 <+tmortagne> i'm saying I don't have everything you said on IRC  
09:24 <+tmortagne> it ends with "it declares a private field "c". The bug/limit"  
09:24 <+mflorea> ah :)  
09:24 <+mflorea> The bug/limitation is that field "c" (notice that I used the same name in both A and B) is not injected in A but only in B, when creating an instance of B, which makes the methods from A fails with NullPointerException.  
09:26 <+mflorea> this is somehow normal because field "c" in B "hides" field "c" in A, but still I would have expected the @Inject to work  
09:26 <+tmortagne> mflorea: this one is tricky actually, the issue is that when you ask for field of the object java does not list the "c" coming from A I think  
09:26 <+mflorea> yep, I think so  
09:27 <+mflorea> so it inject only the "c" form B because it only sees it  
09:28 <+tmortagne> now if B extends A it should know that there is already c injected so it not that much of a details  
09:28 <+tmortagne> we generally either make it protected or add a get method  
09:29 <+mflorea> I added a protected method in A to return "c", and changed B to use it, but I don't like the fact that B relies on an impl detail of A  
09:29 <+tmortagne> in fact I'm not sure checkstyle will like that too much  
09:29 <+mflorea> it doesn't complain  
09:30 <+tmortagne> in any case you should probably create a jira issue  
09:30 <+mflorea> when I say "impl detail" I mean that the protected method I added shouldn't be an "API" of A (an API for derived classes)  
09:31 <+tmortagne> you could make you abstract a component instead if you really want it to be impl details ;)  
09:33 <+mflorea> sure, but I'm thinking for the case when you want to overwrite a component from a JAR for which you don't have the source, and you don't know it defines a private field "c", so you define it yourself and then see that some method in base class start failing with NullPointerException  
09:34 <+mflorea> well, you would say that in this case you implement the interface, and don't extend the component impl  
09:34 <+mflorea> if you extend the impl then you should know something about that impl  
09:38 <Denis3> is now known as <Denis>  
09:42 <+tmortagne> mflorea: in a perfect world yes but in any case if we can support overridden fields we should, I don't have that strong opinion to forbid it. Was just trying to reduce it's importance ;)  
09:42 <+mflorea> sure :)  
09:42 <+tmortagne> unless it's not supported by Guice for example  
09:43 <+tmortagne> will try to find some informations about that on @Inject specs  
09:50 <sburjan> has joined #xwiki  
09:57 <cjdelisle> bringing myxwiki.org down in a few  
09:59 <vmassol> cjdelisle: would be great to announce it using the myxwiki twitter account (just in case)  
09:59 <cjdelisle> can do  
09:59 <vmassol> trying to find the credentials again for myxwiki...  
09:59 <cjdelisle> it's on the upgrading page  
09:59 <vmassol> right  
10:00 <cjdelisle> also the problem with socked exhaustion is my fat fingers, I disabled the check script in cron  
10:00 <vmassol> ah  
10:00 <cjdelisle> there's still something wrong on our end but infra's script is apparently fine  
10:00 <vmassol> ok  
10:01 <cjdelisle> An idea I had would be to add a header that says "going down for maintainence in X minutes"  
10:01 <cjdelisle> also a placeholder while it is down..  
10:02 <vmassol> don't we already have the skol guy?  
10:03 <vmassol> I can ask infra to set that up if we don't have it  
10:04 <cjdelisle> I didn't ever see it when we ran out of sockets, I'm not really an apache expert otherwise I would have dropped a page in.  
10:04 <vmassol> cjdelisle: will the move to FS storage change anything in the DB?  
10:04 <vmassol> (will the attachments still be there too?)  
10:04 <vmassol> (in addition to being on the FS)  
10:05 <vmassol> I want to be sure we have eveyrthing to go back in case of problem  
10:05 <vmassol> if the DB is changed I'd say we should make extra sure to do a backup first  
10:06 <cjdelisle> yes they will remain in the db  
10:06 <cjdelisle> but that's a trickey situation because new ones do not  
10:06 <cjdelisle> they don't get put in the db so over time we get locked in to FS attach  
10:07 <vmassol> we'll need to talk to infra to change their backup procedure for myxwiki.org btw since the directory will also need to be backuped now now  
10:08 <vmassol> (they have DB replication right now which won't cover it)  
10:08 <silviar> has quit  
10:09 <cjdelisle> yup  
10:09 <vmassol> asking infra to do a backup now and telling them about this  
10:11 <vmassol> I'll let you know once I get an answer from them  
10:12 <+tmortagne> how are we going to do support clustering with FS attachment on myxwiki.org ?  
10:12 <cjdelisle> I just tweeted 15 minutes, should I go ahead and upgrade then do the backip later?  
10:12 <cjdelisle> tmortagne: nfs or andrew are good solutions for clustered filesystem access  
10:13 <+tmortagne> just making sure we already decided something before upgrading :)  
10:14 <cjdelisle> it's down to 1 machine at the moment so until the other machine comes back it's not pressing  
10:14 <silviar> has joined #xwiki  
10:14 <+tmortagne> well it will not make it easier to go back to 2 machine  
10:14 <vmassol> cjdelisle: I'd suggest you uprgade to latest version first  
10:15 <vmassol> without any attachment storage change  
10:15 <cjdelisle> changed xwiki.cfg back..  
10:17 <arkub> has joined #xwiki  
10:18 <vmassol> entering meeting  
10:25 <cjdelisle> k bringing it down  
10:26 <vmassol> ok  
10:28 <rrodriguez> has joined #xwiki  
10:29 <cjdelisle> back  
10:30 <vmassol> that was fast  
10:31 <cjdelisle> slow responses from apache...  
10:32 <cjdelisle> hmm might be because lucine is pounding the db right now  
10:36 <cjdelisle> seems to be improving  
10:56 <+mflorea> tmortagne: the current implementation of getRenderedContent() renders the \_translated document content\_ using the syntax of \_this\_ document. This looks odd to me. Moreover, there is a test for this behavior, XWikiDocumentTest#testGetRenderedContent() which creates a document with 2.0 syntax and content and a translation of it with \_2.0\_ content BUT 1.0 syntax. The test expects the 2.0 content of the translated document to be rendered correctly, as 2.0 syntax  
10:58 <+mflorea> I guess the question is if a translation can really have a different syntax than the original document  
10:59 <+mflorea> I can check  
10:59 <+tmortagne> mflorea: officially whatever the model is (XWikiDocument for each translation here), the syntax of the default document is supposed to be used  
10:59 <+tmortagne> (which I don't like more that you do)  
11:00 <+mflorea> I see, that explains the test and the behavior  
11:00 <+tmortagne> hopefully we will get rid of all theses ambiguities with new model  
11:00 <+tmortagne> basically only the content is supposed to be translated  
11:00 <+tmortagne> it's the same for parent etc...  
11:00 <+tmortagne> AFAIK  
11:01 <+mflorea> right  
11:01 <+mflorea> all the rest should be the same  
11:01 <+tmortagne> XWIKI-6056  
11:02 <+tmortagne> there is another one for parent AFAIR  
11:07 <cjdelisle> the panels which were changed to syntax2.0 seem to be broken  
11:25 <Enygma`> has joined #xwiki  
11:54 <+mflorea> tmortagne: if I want to preserver the behavior (render translated content using the syntax of the original document) then I need to be able to access the translated content inside a component. I'm not sure what's best: (1) add DAB#getTranslatedDocument(DocumentReference) or (2) add DMB#getTranslatedDocument() or (3) add DMB#getTranslatedContent() / getTranslatedXDOM(). Note that both (2) and (3) means adding new API to XWikiDocument, so (3) seems to be the b  
11:55 <+mflorea> hmm, wait a sec  
11:56 <+tmortagne> mflorea: pretty sure the DAB already return you the current language translation by default  
12:00 <+mflorea> well, there is a problem. DAB works with DocumentReferences and returns the document from cache/database. So if you get a document that doesn't have translations, then change the content, then call getRenderedContent(), I would render the saved content if I use DAB to get the translated content.  
12:02 <+tmortagne> sure you should not use DAB for anything else than saved document  
12:02 <+mflorea> so I would need to check if the rendered document has a translation for the current language, and if so, get it with DAB, otherwise use the content returned by DMB  
12:02 <+tmortagne> if you need to render something you did not saved yet you will need to find another solution  
12:03 <+tmortagne> mflorea: what do you mean ?  
12:03 <+tmortagne> DAB is supposed to get the current language translation already, is the translation is saved that should work  
12:05 <+tmortagne> is what you want to render saved or not ?  
12:05 <+mflorea> yes, but in the case I mentioned, if the doc doesn't have translations and its content has been changed without being saved then DAB would return the saved content. My point is that I cannot simply use DAB#getDocumentContent  
12:05 <+mflorea> I don't know if it is saved or not. My component gets a DMB  
12:05 <+mflorea> DocumentModelBridge  
12:05 <+mflorea> and I need to render it  
12:05 <+mflorea> i.e. I need to render its translated content  
12:06 <jvdrean> Hi, did we change the db schema between 2.7.2 and 3.1 ?  
12:06 <jvdrean> I see 41 tables in my 2.7.2 schema and 33 in the 3.1 one  
12:06 <+tmortagne> mflorea: ok but it's not your job to take care of situation where someone modified the document from the cache and forgot to save it  
12:06 <vmassol> jvdrean: hmm I don't remember any change  
12:07 <vmassol> let's ask git  
12:07 <jvdrean> all the xwiki\*classes tables seems to be missing, for example xwikibooleanclasses  
12:07 <jvdrean> the farm is running well though  
12:07 <+tmortagne> that's a general issue which is not just about translation anyway  
12:07 <cjdelisle> Those were removed from the mapping but there was no migration necessary for it.  
12:07 <+tmortagne> or I really don't understand your use case  
12:08 <+mflorea> tmortagne: I must use the content of the DMB, otherwise I could have made the interface to take a DocumentReferences  
12:08 <jvdrean> hum on my 2.7.2 instance I get, mysql> select count(\*) from xwikibooleanclasses; -> 0  
12:08 <jvdrean> may be those were legacy that we just removed from the mapping because they weren't used  
12:08 <+mflorea> for instance, this is a valid use case for me:  
12:08 <+mflorea> doc.setContent(newContent);  
12:08 <+mflorea> doc.getRenderedContent();  
12:09 <+tmortagne> ok but in this case you do know the document is not saved  
12:09 <+mflorea> when doc.getRenderedContent() calls displayer.display(this)  
12:09 <+mflorea> s/when/where  
12:09 <+tmortagne> yo said you did not know your document was not saved  
12:10 <+tmortagne> and again this is not really related to translations  
12:10 <+mflorea> the thing is that is works well when there are no translations  
12:11 <+mflorea> it works because I use the DMB content (no translated content)  
12:12 <cjdelisle> hmm going to have to downgrade again until I can track down the cause of these panels being rendered twice  
12:12 <cjdelisle> http://pastebay.com/138354  
12:12 <arkub> has quit  
12:12 <+tmortagne> mflorea: ok but it's very bad design to count on the cache  
12:12 <+tmortagne> there is no contract saying that your not saved document will still be in the cache  
12:13 <+mflorea> I don't count on the cache. Probably I didn't explained very well.  
12:13 <+mflorea> first of all, note the difference between DAB and DMB. My component take a DMB as parameters, so it uses the actual document, not the one from cache or the saved one'  
12:14 <+tmortagne> mflorea: ok but you were talking about DAB at first  
12:15 <+tmortagne> mflorea: seems to me you are doing thing too complex to use the bridge, you shoud probably directly use the oldcore API  
12:15 <+mflorea> yes, because I need to take the translated content and DMB doesn't have any methods for this so I looked at DAB, which has some  
12:15 <+mflorea> (yes -> re "you were talking about DAB at first")  
12:16 <+tmortagne> either directly use it or do you own specialized bridge like we do for wiki macro manipulation for example  
12:16 <+mflorea> and no, I just need the translated content  
12:17 <jvdrean> FYI those tables have been removed from our schema,   XWIKI-6624  
12:17 <+tmortagne> mflorea: in any case you can't use DAB for you use case since you want to manipulate directly the document  
12:18 <+tmortagne> so either you add stuff to DMB or don't use the bridge  
12:19 <+tmortagne> either that or you give directly the document instance to your component  
12:19 <+mflorea> yes, the option I had in mind was to use the DAB only if the language of the DMB instance != context language, in which case it's safe to load the translated content from cache/database  
12:19 <+tmortagne> no actually this can be dangerous  
12:19 <+tmortagne> since if you need other stuff they are going to probably be wrong  
12:20 <+tmortagne> since only the content is supposed to be taken into accountr  
12:21 <+tmortagne> mflorea: you only look at content of the XWikiDocument in your component ?  
12:22 <+mflorea> content and syntax mainly  
12:22 <rrodriguez> has quit  
12:22 <rrodriguez> has joined #xwiki  
12:22 <+tmortagne> also I don't understand something, why would you need to get a translation that is not the current language ?  
12:22 <+tmortagne> aren't you always displaying in the current language  
12:23 <+tmortagne> ok forget that, you do but the document is not alwaus of current language since it's the default one  
12:23 <+tmortagne> but I don't see wht you can get it from the DAB actually  
12:23 <+mflorea> yes, I didn't say (or I didn't mean to say) that I get a translation that is not the current language. What I said is this:  
12:23 <+mflorea> enDoc.getRenderedContent() // when language is FR  
12:24 <+tmortagne> you will have the same issue that made you give the document instance instead of the reference  
12:24 <+tmortagne> since you could have modified the current language content and then call the displayer, couldn't you  
12:25 <+tmortagne> I mean what is the issue with the default language is an issue with the other language too  
12:25 <+mflorea> yes, but let me give you two use cases  
12:26 <vmassol> jvdrean: https://github.com/xwiki/xwiki-platform/commits/master/xwiki-platform-core/xwiki-platform-oldcore/src/main/resources/xwiki.hbm.xml  
12:26 <vmassol> (knowing that 3.1 was released on 21st of june)  
12:27 <jvdrean> vmassol: yes thanks, the commit in question is from May 16, 2011  
12:27 <jvdrean> (jvdrean 12:17 FYI those tables have been removed from our schema,   XWIKI-6624)  
12:27 <+mflorea> (1) context language=FF  
12:27 <+mflorea> enDoc.getRenderedContent()  
12:27 <+mflorea> // In this case is safe to load the FR translation using DAB because  the language of the \_this\_ document != context language  
12:27 <+mflorea> (2) context language=EN  
12:27 <+mflorea> enDoc.setContent("foo");  
12:27 <+mflorea> enDoc.getRenderedContent()  
12:27 <+mflorea> // In this case I can't use the DAB, I have to use the content of the provided DMB  
12:36 <cjdelisle> I just downgraded myxwiki yet again, apparently it has a unique problem with handling doc.display() which is not in the test version and is not new, it shows up in the old version because I downgraded the war before the xar.  
12:36 <jvdrean> has quit  
12:37 <cjdelisle> It seems to render the content twice and then wrap it in {{html}} macros  
12:38 <cjdelisle> Everything seems to be alright, crontab is reenabled, I'm going to catch some sleep and then see if I can understand why that machine behaves differently from mine.  
12:45 <vmassol> cjdelisle: ok, sorry cannot help much, it's meeting day for me  
12:49 <rrodriguez> has quit  
13:50 <jvdrean> has joined #xwiki

14:26 <vmassol> I'm asking since we're getting very near the end of the 3.2 release  
14:33 <+Enygma`> I still working on some refactorings, but I hope to make a pull request by the end of mid next week for the changes in some templates and wiki pages that I need exclusively for Workspaces.  
14:33 <+Enygma`> \*I`m  
14:33 <DrLou> has joined #xwiki  
14:33 <vmassol> Enygma`: and that'll be it?  
14:33 <vmassol> (or is there more needed)  
14:34 <DrLou> has quit  
14:34 <+Enygma`> it should be it for the "hooks" part. After that I should just have to publish as an extension what's left.  
14:34 <vmassol> (sure, was only talking about the platform part)  
14:34 <vmassol> ok good  
14:34 <vmassol> so it won't in M3 but in RC1  
14:34 <vmassol> s/won't/won't be/  
14:35 <+Enygma`> yes. M3 is already late AFAIK.  
14:35 <DrLou> has joined #xwiki  
14:35 <vmassol> yes  
14:35 <vmassol> supposed to be released tomorrow AFAIU  
14:35 <vmassol> btw normally we shouldn't be making any change after M3  
14:36 <+Enygma`> hm... right  
14:37 <pturcotte> has joined #xwiki

15:46 <vmassol> unless you're using an old version of XE ofc :)

15:46 <vmassol> yes that's the old table  
15:46 <JuanDaugherty> well I'm generally talking about the last stable unless I say different  
15:47 <vmassol> so last stable does support chrome  
15:47 <+sburjan> there will be soon a vote on the list  
15:47 <+sburjan> regarding the supported browsers  
15:47 <JuanDaugherty> perhaps we're talking about different "chrome"s  
15:47 <JuanDaugherty> I mean the google browser, not the core infrastructutre  
15:47 <JuanDaugherty> \*infrastructure  
15:48 <vmassol> JuanDaugherty: hmm seems that the old table is still in our distribution though  
15:48 <JuanDaugherty> (Google Chrome 13.0.782.218 )  
15:48 <vmassol> I'm using 15  
15:49 <JuanDaugherty> (Google Chrome 13.0.782.218 on linux)  
15:49 <vmassol> JuanDaugherty: it's here: https://github.com/xwiki/xwiki-platform/tree/master/xwiki-platform-core/xwiki-platform-web/src/main/webapp/resources/js/xwiki/table  
15:49 <vmassol> the js file is https://github.com/xwiki/xwiki-platform/blob/master/xwiki-platform-core/xwiki-platform-web/src/main/webapp/resources/js/xwiki/table/tablefilterNsort.js  
15:49 <vmassol> maybe images have been removed  
15:49 <vmassol> checking  
15:50 <JuanDaugherty> it looks fine on FF which actually is my reference, just happen to use Chrome most of the time  
15:50 <JuanDaugherty> \*in FF  
15:50 <vmassol> ok testing in my chrome now  
15:50 <JuanDaugherty> (little up/down arrows)  
15:53 <vmassol> JuanDaugherty: got a snippet for me to try?  
15:53 <JuanDaugherty> it's the wiki manager  
15:53 <vmassol> found one http://extensions.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Extension/Table+Sorter
